group.title: Selected works from the digital storytelling program: April 2001

results.title: Lest we forget
results.brief_description: A message from mother to son, Darcy who was born on Anzac day 1996. She wants to explain to him that his father left, but that is not his fault and that she is always there for him.

group.title: Selected works from the digital storytelling program: April 2001

results.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
results.brief_description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

constellations_other.name: Kaleidoscopic colour: Chromotrope
constellations_other.description: A focus on distinctive and innovative examples of pattern, colour and movement.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_other.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: Space, cinema and fakes
constellations_other.description: Before and after humans stepped foot on the moon, outer-space and the stars have inspired filmmakers, artists and game makers to imagine what's beyond our atmosphere.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
results.description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.

results.title: Aladdin
results.creator_credit: Kirk Hanson, R.S. vander Wende, Walt Disney Animation Studios, Walt Disney Pictures, Ron Clements, John Musker, Roger Allers, Kevin Lima, Darrell Rooney, Burny Mattinson, Chris Sanders, Brian Pimental, Francis Glebas, Larry Leker, Kevin Harkey, Patrick A. Ventura, Rebecca Reese, Daan Jippes, James Fujii, David Scott Smith, Sue C. Nichols, Ted Elliott and Terry Rossio
results.brief_description: Princess Jasmine grows tired of being forced to remain in the palace, so she sneaks out into the marketplace, in disguise, where she meets street-urchin Aladdin. The couple falls in love, although Jasmine may only marry a prince. After being thrown in jail, Aladdin becomes embroiled in a plot to find a mysterious lamp, with which the evil Jafar hopes to rule the land.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

constellations_other.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_other.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

results.title: Babe: Pig in the City
results.creator_credit: Bill Miller, Norma Moriceau, Roger Ford, Kennedy Miller Productions, Universal Pictures, Mark Lamprell, Doug Mitchell, George Miller and Judy Morris
results.brief_description: Babe, fresh from his victory in the sheepherding contest, returns to Farmer Hoggett’s farm, but after Farmer Hoggett is injured and unable to work, Babe has to go to the big city to save the farm.

results.title: Ӕon Flux
results.creator_credit: MTV, MTV Animation and Colossal Pictures
results.brief_description: Æon Flux is set in a bizarre, dystopian future world. The title character is a tall, leather-clad secret agent from the nation of Monica, skilled in assassination and acrobatics. Her mission is to infiltrate the strongholds of the neighboring country of Bregna, which is led by her sometimes-nemesis and sometimes-lover Trevor Goodchild. Monica represents a dynamic anarchist society, while Bregna embodies a police state.

results.title: Zodiac
results.brief_description: The true story of the investigation of the “Zodiac Killer”, a serial killer who terrified the San Francisco Bay Area, taunting police with his ciphers and letters. The case becomes an obsession for three men as their lives and careers are built and destroyed by the endless trail of clues.
